attributes.action: Give the UK a vote on "remain in the EU" or "accept the exit terms agreed"
attributes.additional_details:
Many did not understand the issues at hand: https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-switch/wp/2016/06/24/the-british-are-frantically-googling-what-the-eu-is-hours-after-voting-to-leave-it/

Older people voted to leave, though younger people (who have to live with the result) wanted to stay:
http://time.com/4381878/brexit-generation-gap-older-younger-voters/

The economic impact is unparalleled:
http://metro.co.uk/2016/06/24/france-overtakes-uk-as-fifth-largest-economy-as-pound-plummets-5964746/
attributes.background: Given the close result of the EU referendum, and the significant impact of the decisions it is imperative the UK is given a 2nd stage referendum on the terms of the exit versus remaining in the EU. This must be offered before article 50 is invoked or any referendums on regional independence.
